citations.desc: ATTENDING VETERINARIAN AND ADEQUATE VETERINARY CARE (DEALERS AND EXHIBITORS).
citations.narrative:
The carbon dioxide tank used for the euthanasia of rabbits has a pressure reducing regulator, but there is currently
no flow meter. The 2013 edition of the AVMA Guidelines for the Euthanasia of Animals states that an appropriate
pressure reducing regulator and flow meter or equivalent with demonstrated capability for generating the
recommended displacement rates for the size container being utilized is absolutely necessary for the humane
application of CO2. A flow meter needs to be added to the CO2 tank and pressure reducing regulator to ensure the
animals are appropriately euthanized following the AVMA Guidelines. Correct by August 10, 2016.
An exit briefing was conducted with owner.

narrative:
2.40(b)(1)
